APE GENiUS (DVD5, 2008)

WHAT SEPARATES APES FROM HUMANS?

We found something quite surprising, the human children were predisposed to copying, even when they were doing something that was really rather silly.

 That human children expect to be taught is a vital difference.

Never before has any non-human species been known to routinely make and use deadly weapons. So what does spear-hunting reveal about how chimpanzees think? Dr Savage-Rumbaugh, of the Great Ape Trust, in Des Moines, Iowa, adds:

At the age of five, he was making small piles of bone dry sticks.

He was taught to use matches, a skill he picked up quickly.
